channel.title: How would you prepare?
channel.description:
when i watch tv, I am watching the science channel, discovery channel, history channel, nat geo wild like stuff like that. Alot of the shows now are about "aliens are coming" I dont know if it's true or not but theres pictures of alien ships moving fast towards earth. They might think that got kicked out of there solar system and had to leave from war or something, or they could just be searching around. well here are some pictures of the stuff they find.
http://science.discovery.com/videos/are-we-alone-alien-encounters-videos/
http://science.discovery.com/videos/alien-encounters-space-powered-alien-ship.html
Well after you watch the video and stuff. IF it's true let's say... How would you prepare? Would you like stack up on food + water and make like a bunker. Would you be excited to meet new life? What do you think the aliens would be like. It just amazes me how fascinating this is. I mean Humas are still using natural resources to run our machines like gas! If they can make it here then there technology there is really advanced there! IF they were nice friendly aliens, what IF they shared the solar system with us? Expand our technology and science! It would be great to know alot of this stuff. Well I guess the main question being asked here is what do you think you would do if Aliens came. Do you think america should fight them? Also in the episode it said that humans natural reaction is to respond physically in our subconsious mind. We wouldnt think we just attack then realize or something lol. Ok enough with this thread I wanna know what you think !

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:128, topic:459831”][quote author=KroniKz_ link=topic=562734.msg4111079#msg4111079 date=1348523352]
just because your knowledge isn’t good enough to understand any of this you don’t have to act like an idiot. Please.
[/quote]
The artificial elements may be to find inside a black hole if the black hole hasn’t destroyed it yet. But no alien get get something out from it.

The strongest reaction we know about causes black holes, and they have not found some magical elements from weaker reactions. It also need to be an abundance of it to be a viable building material for life.

If we don’t try to keep ourselves inside the boundaries of science, we could just say:

“God did it /thread”

And then we can move onto alternative history, or how we could be down the path of a new world war.[/quote]
I was talking to classic and death about that.

Read full topic

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

KroniKz_:

just because your knowledge isn’t good enough to understand any of this you don’t have to act like an idiot. Please.

The artificial elements may be to find inside a black hole if the black hole hasn’t destroyed it yet. But no alien get get something out from it.

The strongest reaction we know about causes black holes, and they have not found some magical elements from weaker reactions. It also need to be an abundance of it to be a viable building material for life.

If we don’t try to keep ourselves inside the boundaries of science, we could just say:

“God did it /thread”

And then we can move onto alternative history, or how we could be down the path of a new world war.

Read full topic

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

In Soviet Russia, Combo breaks you.

KroniKz:
I was considering making a thread about how the world would be without France, but I find that to be not serious enough.

Artificial elements are artificial because of their lack of stability and/or difficulty to make in natural processes. Because of that we can safely assume that everyone has the same elements.

What we have not consider is dark matter, but any speculations about it is purely speculative.

Read full topic

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:123, topic:459831”]Kro: I’m judging it based on physics and how elements are made, and I’m basing it on maths.

The elements needed for creating life is the most abundant elements. Therefore it is safe to say that the first alien to visit us is most likely carbon based. And that non-carbon life most likely would be defeated in competition with any carbon based organism living on the same planet.[/quote]
i didnt deny that, I was just stating a theory that they could have CARBON but new elements that we are yet to discover. Like artificial elements, do you think they have natural elements that we could not have “theoretically”.
This conversation is starting to lose its base, were now getting into science and I actually like it, but we keep getting more fictional

Read full topic

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Kro: I’m judging it based on physics and how elements are made, and I’m basing it on maths.

The elements needed for creating life is the most abundant elements. Therefore it is safe to say that the first alien to visit us is most likely carbon based. And that non-carbon life most likely would be defeated in competition with any carbon based organism living on the same planet.

Read full topic

item.title: How would you prepare?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:121, topic:459831”][quote author=KroniKz_ link=topic=562734.msg4110955#msg4110955 date=1348516434]

They could be like us due to being a carbon based(I believe its carbon) planet.

Our planet is based around carbon hydrogen oxygen phosperus nitrogen. Those are the 5 main elements in our planet, there planet might have more elements that they can live off of.
[/quote]
Hydrogen and Helium are the most common elements in the universe. Then comes the elements from lithium to oxygen, and next is fluoride to iron I think. The reason for this is that it is harder to create heavier elements. And for every new group, you need a more advanced reaction.

Or not even have those elements and just there own periodic table.

[size=5pt]NO[/size][/quote]
trust me the 5 important elements are the 5 i listed.

and to the second part, you don’t even know, who are you to say no. You think anything in life needs those elements, your just judging off the elements in the solar system.

Read full topic
